tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 241 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to swarm the battlefield with aggressive Elves, using cards like Elvish Mystic, Llanowar Elves, and Priest of Titania to ramp up mana production. With powerful support cards like Timberwatch Elf and Generous Ent, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and strong offense. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help replenish the hand with more Elves, while Masked Vandal provides removal and disruption. Wellwisher offers some life gain, while Crashing Drawbridge can give the team haste for a surprise attack.

This deck focuses on generating value through sacrificing creatures and artifacts, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells, while also being able to recover from board wipes or removal with cards like Pulse of Murasa. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle of the deck, allowing for consistency in casting spells and ensuring a smooth curve throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly push damage through aggressive creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to finish off opponents. The deck aims to maintain a steady stream of pressure with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, keeping the opponent on their back foot. Additionally, it includes lifegain options like Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss to help stabilize against opposing aggro strategies. The mana base is a mix of Rakdos dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells.

This deck focuses on using walls and defenders to generate mana and protect the player while setting up a powerful combo. By utilizing cards like Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement to generate large amounts of mana, the player can then use Freed from the Real to repeatedly untap their creatures and produce even more mana. This combo can lead to a massive advantage in resources and allow the player to quickly overwhelm their opponent. The walls also provide defense against aggressive strategies, making the deck resilient and versatile.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Spellstutter Sprite, the deck aims to maintain board presence and counter any threats from the opponent. The inclusion of Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for card advantage and potential tempo swings. The spell package of countermagic like Counterspell and disruption spells like Force Spike and Spell Pierce help to control the game and protect the aggressive creatures. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and control the game until victory is achieved.

The main focus of this deck is  to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, efficient creatures while also utilizing the synergies between them. By efficiently utilizing cards that generate token creatures and cards that benefit from having a large number of creatures on the battlefield, the deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and aggressively attack the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes some protection spells to help keep the creatures on the battlefield and maintain pressure on the opponent.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and utilizing efficient creatures like Seeker of the Way and Squadron Hawk to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt for reach and removal, as well as cards like Battle Screech and Prismatic Strands for extra value. By combining aggressive creatures with versatile spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of Faithless Looting helps maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws.

The main focus of this mono green aggro deck is to quickly pump up and protect creature cards such as Glistener Elf and Ichorclaw Myr to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes pump spells like Rancor, Might of Old Krosa, and Mutagenic Growth to increase the power of its creatures, while also using protective spells like Vines of Vastwood, Snakeskin Veil, and Apostle's Blessing to keep them safe from removal. The inclusion of Embiggen and Escape Tunnel helps to further enhance the aggression and versatility of the deck.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures like Infestation Sage, Shambling Ghast, and Serrated Scorpion. These creatures work well with sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Bloodthrone Vampire to pump up Mortician Beetle and Accursed Marauder. Village Rites, Unearth, and Supernatural Stamina provide card advantage and graveyard recursion, while Rite of Consumption and Sadistic Glee serve as finishers. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of threats and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the Urza Tron lands (Power Plant, Tower, Mine) to generate massive amounts of mana. It uses cards like Myr Retriever and Ashnod's Altar for mana acceleration, while also utilizing Foundry Inspector and Energy Refractor to reduce the cost of spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Pactdoll Terror and Fanatical Offering, while also drawing cards and gaining advantage with Ichor Wellspring and Prophetic Prism. It has the ability to quickly ramp up and overwhelm opponents with powerful spells like Eviscerator's Insight.
